question: I applied for health coverage through COMPASS but was told that I am not eligible for coverage through Medicaid (Medical Assistance), and that my application has been transferred to Pennie. What does that mean? What happens next?
text:
I applied for health coverage through COMPASS but was told that I am not eligible for coverage through Medicaid (Medical Assistance), and that my application has been transferred to Pennie. What does that mean? What happens next? 
          
        
It simply means that you can still apply, shop, and enroll in health coverage that is affordable and fits your needs on Pennsylvanias new state-based marketplace  Pennie. You will receive a notice from Pennie with information on how to claim your new Pennie account, complete your application, and enroll in coverage. If you enroll in coverage through Pennie, you may qualify for financial assistance to lower the cost of health coverage and care.
